name: Water
description: A transparent, tasteless, odorless, and nearly colorless chemical substance essential for all known forms of life.

name: Ethanol
description: A volatile, flammable, colorless liquid used in alcoholic beverages and as an industrial solvent.

name: Sodium Chloride
description: Common table salt, an ionic compound consisting of sodium and chloride ions.

name: Oxygen
description: A colorless gas essential for respiration and combustion processes.

name: Glucose
description: A simple sugar that is an important energy source in living organisms.

name: Acetic Acid
description: A colorless liquid organic compound with a pungent smell, widely used in vinegar.

name: Carbon Dioxide
description: A colorless, odorless gas produced by respiration and combustion of carbon compounds.

name: Sodium Bicarbonate
description: Commonly known as baking soda, used in cooking, cleaning, and medicine.

name: Hydrochloric Acid
description: A strong acid used in various industrial processes and laboratory applications.

name: Sodium Hydroxide
description: A strong base used in various industrial applications and as a cleaning agent.

name: Ammonia
description: A colorless gas with a pungent odor, commonly used in agriculture and cleaning products.

name: Benzene
uses: precursor to resins, rubber, lubricants, dyes, detergents, drugs, pesticides
description: Benzene is an aromatic hydrocarbon consisting of six carbon atoms arranged in a ring with alternating double bonds. It is a colorless, sweet-smelling, highly flammable liquid widely used as an industrial solvent and as a precursor in the production of numerous chemicals and materials.

name: Nitric Acid
description: A strong acid used in various industrial processes and laboratory applications.

name: Potassium Chloride
description: A colorless or white crystalline salt used in food processing and as a potassium supplement.

name: Sulfuric Acid
description: A highly corrosive strong mineral acid used in various industrial applications.

name: Calcium Chloride
description: A white crystalline salt used for de-icing roads and as a drying agent.

name: Calcium Carbonate
description: A common substance found in rocks, used in construction and as a dietary supplement.

name: Magnesium Sulfate
description: A white crystalline salt used in agriculture and as a laxative.

name: Potassium Nitrate
description: A colorless or white crystalline salt used in fertilizers and food preservation.

name: Zinc Oxide
description: A white powder used in sunscreens, ointments, and as a pigment in various products.

name: Copper Sulfate
description: A blue crystalline solid used in agriculture and as a chemical reagent.

name: Iron(III) Oxide
description: A reddish-brown solid used as a pigment and in the production of steel.

name: Lead(II) Nitrate
description: A white crystalline solid used in the production of explosives and glass.

name: Sodium Acetate
description: A colorless solid used in food preservation and as a buffer in chemical reactions.

name: Sodium Phosphate
description: A white crystalline solid used in cleaning products and as a food additive.

name: Calcium Sulfate
description: A white solid used in construction materials like drywall and plaster.

name: Aluminum Sulfate
description: A white crystalline solid used in water treatment and as a mordant in dyeing processes.

name: Silicon Dioxide
description: A hard, colorless solid found in nature as quartz and used in glass and ceramics.

name: Sodium Sulfate
description: A white crystalline solid used in detergents and as a drying agent.

name: Polyethylene Teterephthalate
description: A thermoplastic polymer used in the production of plastic bottles, textiles, and food containers.

name: Plastic Bottle
description: A thermoplastic polymer used in the production of plastic bottles, textiles, and food containers.

name: Polyvinyl Chloride
description: A widely used synthetic plastic polymer used in construction, electrical insulation, and flooring.

name: Carbonated Water
uses: Carbonated water is widely used as a beverage and in cocktails
plays a role in various industrial processes.
description: Carbonated water, also known as soda water, sparkling water, or seltzer water, is essentially water infused with carbon dioxide gas. The dissolved CO2 reacts with water to form carbonic acid (H2CO3), which is responsible for the characteristic fizz and slightly sour taste.

name: Sucrose
hazards: excessive consumption can lead to health issues
description: A common naturally occurring sugar found in plants, widely used as a sweetener in foods and beverages.

name: Citric Acid
hazards: can cause irritation in concentrated form
description: A weak organic acid naturally found in citrus fruits, commonly used in foods and beverages for flavoring and preservation.

name: Sodium Citrate
hazards: can cause mild irritation in concentrated form
description: A sodium salt of citric acid, widely used as a buffering agent in foods, beverages, and medical applications.

name: Taurine
hazards: may cause skin and eye irritation
hazardous if inhaled at high concentrations
description: Taurine (2-aminoethanesulfonic acid) is a naturally occurring organic compound, widely present in mammalian tissues. Though often called an amino acid, it is not incorporated into proteins. It’s commonly used in supplements and energy drinks, and added nutritionally in pet foods to meet dietary needs for animals like cats. Taurine plays roles in bile salt formation, cell volume regulation, and acts as an antioxidant.

name: Tartaric Acid
hazards: can cause irritation if ingested in high amounts
description: A naturally occurring organic acid used in food and beverages for its sour taste and as a stabilizer.

name: Nicotinamide
hazards: high doses may cause nausea or liver toxicity
description: Nicotinamide is a form of vitamin B3 used to prevent and treat pellagra, support skin health, and as a supplement in food and pharmaceuticals.

name: Niacin(Nicotinic Acid)
hazards: high doses may cause flushing, liver toxicity, or insulin resistance
description: Niacin, also known as vitamin B3 or nicotinic acid, is an essential nutrient involved in metabolism and energy production. It is used in supplements, food fortification, and to help manage cholesterol levels.

name: Pyridoxine
uses: supports metabolism of amino acids, glucose, and lipids
used in treatment of certain types of anemia and neurological disorders
hazards: high doses may cause sensory neuropathy
mild side effects include nausea and photosensitivity
description: Pyridoxine is one of the forms of vitamin B6, essential for protein and neurotransmitter metabolism. It is widely used in dietary supplements and plays a critical role in enzymatic reactions within the body.

name: Cobalamin
uses: essential for red blood cell formation
used in treatment of pernicious anemia
hazards: very high doses might cause acne-like symptoms
description: Vitamin B12 (Cobalamin) is a water-soluble vitamin containing cobalt. It is crucial for DNA synthesis, fatty acid metabolism, and energy production. Deficiency can cause anemia, fatigue, and neurological problems. It is mainly obtained from animal-based foods or supplements.

name: Sodium Benzoate
uses: food preservative (in acidic foods like dressings, soft drinks, jams, fruit juices, pickles)
hazards: can form benzene with ascorbic acid under heat/light
description: Sodium benzoate is the sodium salt of benzoic acid, commonly used as a food preservative (E-number E211) in acidic products. It is also applied in pharmaceuticals and cosmetics, and used in pyrotechnics as a fuel component.

properties.solubility_in_water: 62.65 g/100 mL at 0 °C, up to 74.2 g/100 mL at 100 °C

name: Caffeine(1,3,7-trimethylxanthine)
uses: added to energy drinks, soft drinks, medications
description: Caffeine is the world's most widely consumed psychoactive substance, a methylxanthine alkaloid and central nervous system stimulant. It acts by blocking adenosine receptors, increasing alertness and concentration.

properties.solubility_in_water: 2.17 g/100 mL at 25 °C; more in hot water

safety_notes: Moderate intake (~400 mg/day) is safe for most adults; higher doses may cause jitteriness, increased heart rate, and other adverse effects.
